intro: Homaida russelliana, commonly known as the Russell's homaida, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often in forest undergrowth. Its botanical features include opposite leaf arrangement and the presence of milky sap. It is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
